feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [LIM1][Dedicated Servers] - Rack L122B01/L122B02/L122B03/L122B04/L122B05 maintenance notification.
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jan 6, 2026, 05:00 - 16:00 UTC

Nov 20, 22:28 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our network infrastructure.

Start time : 06/01/2026 05:00 UTC
End time : 06/01/2026 16:00 UTC
Service impact : During the maintenance servers located in racks L122B01, L122B02, L122B03, L122B04 and L122B05 will experience a loss of network connectivity for 1 hour.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to carry out interventions on multiple network equipments on the specified racks.

Thank you for your understanding.

Oct 30, 14:24 UTC

GRA0327A06B
GRA0327A06C
GRA0327A07A
GRA0327A05B

entry.title: [RBX6][Dedicated Servers] - Rack 46J17 incident notification
entry.content:
Nov 23, 06:54 UTC
Resolved - We are pleased to inform you that the incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offering in the rack 46J17 has been resolved.

Start time : 23/11/2025 04:43 UTC
End time : 23/11/2025 06:51 UTC
Root Cause : This incident is caused by a network equipment issue.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Nov 23, 06:28 UTC
Update - The incident is still ongoing. We would like to assure you that we are doing our utmost to resolve this situation as quickly as possible.

As soon as the situation evolves or the incident is resolved, we will keep you informed.

Thank you for your understanding

Nov 23, 04:55 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Dedicated Servers offering in the rack 46J17.

Here is detail for this incident :
Start time : 23/11/2025 04:43 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : All Servers in the rack 46J17 are no longer able to access the public network.
Customers Impact : Customers are temporarily unable to access their servers via public network located on the specified rack.
Root Cause : This incident is caused by a network equipment issue.
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilised to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.
